C++11 gave us enum class and while it’s great to have scoped enums I don’t find it great for error handling. Let’s talk about why.

C++ Enum Class and Error Codes

by Mathieu Ropert

From the article:

Most of my readers, I hope, have been able to use C++11 for a while now (if not hello, I’m sorry the world has changed to become this weird during your 14 years sleep). With it came a small change that allowed for better scoping of names without resorting to weird quirks: enum class.
